data.title: Front Month Nymex ULSD Rose 4.23% This Month to Settle at $2.4312 — Data Talk
data.description:
Front Month Nymex ULSD for Nov. delivery gained 9.87 cents per gallon, or 4.23% to $2.4312 this month

  • Largest one month net and percentage gain since June 2025
  • Up for two consecutive months
  • Up 16.45 cents or 7.26% over the last two months
  • Largest two month net and percentage gain since July 2025
  • Up four of the past five months
  • This week it is up 2.81 cents or 1.17%
  • Up for two consecutive weeks
  • Up 25.12 cents or 11.52% over the last two weeks
  • Largest two week net and percentage gain since the week ending June 20, 2025
  • Today it is down 2.88 cents or 1.17%
  • Snaps a two session winning streak
  • Off 7.24% from its 52-week high of $2.621 hit Friday, Jan. 17, 2025
  • Up 23.13% from its 52-week low of $1.9745 hit Monday, May 5, 2025
  • Rose 8.82% from 52 weeks ago
  • Off 7.24% from its 2025 settlement high of $2.621 hit Friday, Jan. 17, 2025
  • Up 23.13% from its 2025 settlement low of $1.9745 hit Monday, May 5, 2025
  • Off 52.66% from its record high of $5.1354 hit Thursday, April 28, 2022
  • Year-to-date it is up 11.06 cents or 4.77%

All prices are calculated based on the settlement price of the current front month contract.

Source: Dow Jones Market Data

data.title: Westlake Chemical Partners LP SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Westlake Chemical Partners LP, a leading producer and supplier of ethylene and co-products, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights the company's financial performance and operational activities, providing insights into its revenue generation, cost management, and future outlook.

Financial Highlights

Total Net Sales: $308.9 million, an increase of $31.9 million or 11.5% from the third quarter of 2024, primarily due to higher ethylene sales prices and sales volumes to Westlake.

Gross Profit: $99.4 million, a decrease from $116.9 million in the third quarter of 2024, with a gross profit margin of 32.2% compared to 42.2% in the prior year, primarily due to higher ethane feedstock and natural gas costs.

Income from Operations: $92.0 million, a decrease from $109.7 million in the third quarter of 2024, reflecting lower third-party sales prices and higher feedstock costs.

Net Income: $86.2 million, a decrease of $17.9 million compared to $104.1 million in the third quarter of 2024, impacted by lower third-party sales prices and higher costs.

Net Income Attributable to Westlake Chemical Partners LP: $14.7 million, a decrease from $18.1 million in the third quarter of 2024, due to decreased earnings at OpCo and higher maintenance capital expenditures.

Net Income Per Limited Partner Unit (Basic and Diluted): $0.42, a decrease from $0.51 in the third quarter of 2024, reflecting the overall decrease in net income.

Business Highlights

Revenue Segments: The Partnership generates revenue primarily through the sale of ethylene and co-products. A significant portion of ethylene production is sold to Westlake under a long-term, fee-based Ethylene Sales Agreement, which includes variable pricing based on actual feedstock and natural gas costs, estimated operating costs, and a fixed margin per pound.

Sales Units: The Partnership's ethylene production facilities include two units at Lake Charles, Louisiana, and one at Calvert City, Kentucky. The production volumes were impacted by the Petro 1 turnaround, which extended into April 2025, affecting sales volumes to Westlake and third parties.

Operational Performance: The Partnership's operations were affected by higher ethane feedstock and natural gas costs, which contributed to a decrease in gross profit margins. The Petro 1 turnaround also led to lower production volumes, impacting sales volumes and operational efficiency.

Future Outlook: The Partnership has renewed the Ethylene Sales Agreement and the Feedstock Supply Agreement with Westlake through December 31, 2027. This renewal is expected to provide stability in revenue generation and operational planning.

Operational Challenges: The Petro 1 turnaround, which was delayed, resulted in a forecasted annual production deficiency. This led to the recognition of a buyer deficiency fee of $13.6 million during the nine months ended September 30, 2025.

Geographical Performance: The Partnership's ethylene production facilities are strategically located in the United States, with significant sales to Westlake, which accounted for approximately 87.3% of net sales during the nine months ended September 30, 2025.

Operational Strategy: The Partnership aims to manage operating expenses, maintenance capital expenditures, and turnaround costs effectively to maximize profitability. This includes scheduling maintenance and turnarounds to minimize cash flow variability while ensuring safety and environmental compliance.

SEC Filing: Westlake Chemical Partners LP [ WLKP ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: WESTLAKE CORP SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Westlake Corp, a leading global manufacturer and supplier of essential materials and housing products, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights a challenging period for the company, marked by significant declines in financial performance and operational adjustments in response to market conditions.

Financial Highlights

Net Sales: Westlake Corp reported net sales of $2,838 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, a decrease from $3,117 million in the same period of 2024. This decline was primarily driven by reduced demand and lower prices.

Gross Profit: The company's gross profit fell to $236 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, down from $499 million in the same period of 2024, indicating a significant decline in profitability.

Income (Loss) from Operations: Westlake Corp reported a loss from operations of $(766) million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to an income of $180 million in the same period of 2024. This loss was largely impacted by a goodwill impairment charge.

Net Income (Loss) Attributable to Westlake Corporation: The company recorded a net loss of $(782) million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to a net income of $108 million in the same period of 2024. The net loss was driven by the impairment of goodwill and reduced sales.

Basic Earnings (Loss) Per Common Share: The basic loss per common share was $(6.06) for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to earnings of $0.84 in the same period of 2024, reflecting the significant net loss incurred.

Business Highlights

Revenue Segments: The Performance and Essential Materials segment reported net external sales of $1,747 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025. Within this segment, Performance Materials contributed $1,010 million, and Essential Materials contributed $737 million. The Housing and Infrastructure Products segment reported net external sales of $1,091 million, with Housing Products contributing $928 million and Infrastructure Products contributing $163 million.

Geographical Performance: The company's North American Chlorovinyls business has been significantly impacted by declining prices and reduced demand, leading to operating losses and a downward revision of forecasts. Both the European and North American markets have been affected by macroeconomic conditions, including the war in Ukraine, energy price volatility, and inflation.

Sales Units: The Performance and Essential Materials segment experienced lower prices and weak demand globally, particularly in the chlorovinyls and epoxy markets, due to overcapacity and increased exports from Asia.

New Production Launches: Westlake Corp approved the shutdown of its polyvinyl chloride (PVC) resin unit at Suzhou Huasu Plastics in China due to a lack of long-term economic viability. However, the company will continue operations of the PVC calendar products unit.

Future Outlook: The company expects continued uncertainty in import tariff regimes, trading relationships, and macroeconomic conditions to impact margins and demand for most products. The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act of 2021 and historically low residential housing construction may have a favorable long-term impact on the Housing and Infrastructure Products segment, despite current inflationary pressures and high mortgage rates.

SEC Filing: WESTLAKE CORP [ WLK ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: CPS TECHNOLOGIES CORP/DE/ SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
CPS Technologies Corp, a leading provider of advanced material solutions, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report reveals substantial improvements in both financial performance and operational capabilities, driven by increased demand for its core product lines and strategic initiatives aimed at future growth.

Financial Highlights

  • Total Revenue: $8.8 million, increased by 107% compared to Q3 2024 due to growing demand in MMC and hermetic packages product lines and increased funding under the SBIR program.
  • Gross Profit: $1.5 million, representing 17% of sales, compared to a gross loss of $0.5 million in Q3 2024, driven by higher revenues and improved cost management.
  • Operating Income: $0.3 million, compared to an operating loss of $1.5 million in Q3 2024, reflecting increased gross margin and higher sales volume.
  • Net Income: $0.2 million, compared to a net loss of $1.0 million in Q3 2024, attributed to increased revenue and improved operational efficiency.
  • Net Income Per Basic Common Share: $0.01, compared to a loss of $0.07 per share in Q3 2024, indicating a return to profitability.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: The company experienced significant growth in its MMC and hermetic packages product lines, contributing to a 107% increase in revenues for Q3 2025 compared to Q3 2024. This growth was supported by increased demand and additional funding from the federal government's SBIR program.
  • Sales Units: The company added a third shift in September 2024 to meet growing demand, indicating an increase in production capacity and operational scale.
  • New Product Launches: The company is actively developing new product lines, including AlMax® fiber reinforced aluminum and radiation shielding, which are expected to contribute to future growth.
  • New Production Launches: The company is searching for a larger facility to accommodate increased customer demand and potential growth in new product lines, indicating plans for capacity expansion.
  • Future Outlook: The company anticipates continued growth in demand for its core products and is exploring opportunities for new armor orders and expanded product development efforts. The recent equity raise will support relocation and expansion efforts to meet these demands.

SEC Filing: CPS TECHNOLOGIES CORP/DE/ [ CPSH ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: American Assets Trust, Inc. SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
American Assets Trust, Inc., a prominent real estate investment trust (REIT) specializing in retail, office, multifamily, and mixed-use properties, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter. The report provides a comprehensive overview of the company's financial and operational performance, reflecting both challenges and strategic moves within the real estate market.

Financial Highlights

  • Total Revenue: $326.1 million, reflecting a decrease from $344.4 million in the same period last year, primarily due to lower rental income and other property income.
  • Operating Income: $122.7 million, an increase from $99.2 million in the prior year, driven by a gain on the sale of real estate.
  • Net Income: $67.1 million, up from $61.2 million in the previous year, benefiting from the gain on the sale of Del Monte Center.
  • Net Income Attributable to American Assets Trust, Inc. Stockholders: $52.5 million, compared to $47.8 million in the prior year, reflecting improved operating income.
  • Earnings Per Common Share, Basic: $0.87, an increase from $0.79 in the previous year, indicating improved profitability per share.
  • Earnings Per Common Share, Diluted: $0.87, consistent with the basic earnings per share, showing no significant dilution effect.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: The company operates in four reportable business segments: retail real estate, office real estate, multifamily real estate, and mixed-use real estate. The office segment generated the highest lease rental income, followed by retail, multifamily, and mixed-use segments.
  • Geographical Performance: The company's properties are concentrated in Southern California, Northern California, Washington, Oregon, Texas, and Hawaii. Sixteen properties are located in Southern California, indicating a significant exposure to this region's economic conditions.
  • New Product Launches: The company acquired Genesee Park, a 192-unit apartment community in San Diego, California, during the reporting period, expanding its multifamily segment.
  • Dispositions: The company sold Del Monte Center in Monterey, California, which was part of its retail segment, for $123.5 million, resulting in a gain on sale.
  • Future Outlook: The company continues to focus on its core segments and geographical areas, with an emphasis on maintaining and enhancing its property portfolio through strategic acquisitions and dispositions.

SEC Filing: American Assets Trust, Inc. [ AAT ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: Alkami Technology Is Maintained at Overweight by JP Morgan
data.description: (19:13 GMT) Alkami Technology Price Target Cut to $38.00/Share From $40.00 by JP Morgan

data.title: Theta Network Partners With Deutsche Telekom
data.description:
Theta Network has announced that Deutsche Telekom’s Telekom Web3 Infrastructure & Solutions division has joined the platform as an enterprise validator node operator, alongside existing partners such as Google, Samsung and Sony.

THETA Info

Theta is a specialized blockchain-driven platform designed for video streaming. Launched in March 2019, it intends to revolutionize the video streaming landscape by addressing issues like centralization, inefficient infrastructure, and high costs that detriment both viewers and content creators. The initiative is endorsed by industry stalwarts, including Steve Chen, the co-founder of YouTube, and Justin Kan, the co-founder of Twitch.

Theta’s primary objective is to decentralize video streaming, edge computing, and data delivery. This decentralization seeks to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and create a more equitable ecosystem for all stakeholders in the industry. At its core, Theta runs on its native blockchain. It employs a two-token system: THETA and Theta Fuel (TFUEL). The decentralization process rewards viewers with a superior streaming experience, allows content creators to boost their revenues, and helps video platforms save on infrastructure costs while potentially increasing ad and subscription incomes. Users are incentivized to consume content and share resources, with rewards dispensed in TFUEL tokens. Additionally, Theta supports developers aiming to deploy decentralized applications (DApps) on its EVM-compatible Smart contract platform.

The THETA token is integral to the Theta network, carrying out various governance roles. Prominent enterprises such as Google, Binance, Sony Europe, Samsung, and others serve as Enterprise validators, supplemented by a vast Guardian network of community-operated nodes. The platform’s open-source nature grants token holders governance capabilities, typical of many proof-of-stake (PoS) blockchain systems.

data.title: Carrier Global Is Maintained at Neutral by JP Morgan

data.title: US natural gas futures soar to six-month high on LNG export surge
data.description:
Key points:
  • Record LNG export flows drive demand increase
  • Gas output in Lower 48 states declines in October
  • Forecasts predict higher gas demand in coming weeks
  • Oil-to-gas ratio hits lowest since Dec 2022
  • Gas storage levels about 4% above normal, easing supply concerns

By Scott DiSavino

U.S. natural gas futures jumped about 4% on Friday to a six-month high, on near-record flows to liquefied natural gas (LNG) export plants, as output dropped and forecasters expected more demand over the next two weeks than they did previously.

Front-month gas futures for December delivery on the New York Mercantile Exchange rose 16.8 cents, or 4.2%, to $4.124 per million British thermal units (mmBtu), their highest close since April 3. For the first time in four weeks, the contract remained technically overbought for a second straight day.

For the week, the front-month was up about 25%, its biggest weekly percentage gain since a record of around 33% in May 2024. Last week, the contract rose 10%.

For the month, the contract was up about 25%, its biggest monthly percentage gain since February. It gained 10% last month.

Crude futures have dropped 12% over the past three months, so the oil-to-gas ratio, the level where oil trades compared with gas, narrowed to 15-to-1, its lowest since December 2022. On an energy equivalent basis, oil should only trade six times over gas.

So far in 2025, crude prices have averaged about 19 times over gas, down from 33 times over gas in 2024 and 21 times over gas during the prior five years (2019-2023).

SUPPLY AND DEMAND

LSEG said average gas output in the Lower 48 states fell to 107.0 billion cubic feet per day (bcfd) so far in October, down from 107.5 bcfd in September and a record monthly high of 108.0 bcfd in August.

Record output earlier this year allowed energy companies to inject more gas into storage than usual. There is about 4% more gas in storage than normal for this time of year.

Meteorologists forecast temperatures across the country will remain mostly warmer than normal through November 15, which should limit heating demand.

LSEG projected average gas demand in the Lower 48 states, including exports, would hold around 108.9 bcfd this week and next before rising to 109.8 bcfd in two weeks. The forecasts for this week and next were higher than LSEG's outlook on Thursday.

The average amount of gas flowing to the eight big U.S. LNG export plants rose to 16.6 bcfd so far in October from 15.7 bcfd in September and surpassing the monthly record high of 16.0 bcfd in April.

On a daily basis, LNG feedgas was on track to rise to 17.9 bcfd on Friday, which would top the current record of 17.3 bcfd on October 25.

data.title: Tim SA expected to post earnings of 41 cents a share - Earnings Preview
data.description:
• Tim SA , is expected to show a rise in quarterly revenue when it reports results on November 3 for the period ending September 30 2025

  • The Rio De Janeiro-based company is expected to report a 6.5% increase in revenue to $1.233 billion from $1.16 billion a year ago, according to the mean estimate from 2 analysts, based on LSEG data.

  • ​LSEG's mean analyst estimate for Tim SA is for earnings of 41 cents per share.

  • The current average analyst rating on the shares is "hold" and the breakdown of recommendations is 2 "strong buy" or "buy," 5 "hold" and no "sell" or "strong sell."

  • The mean earnings estimate of analysts was unchanged in the last three months. ​

  • Wall Street's median 12-month price target for Tim SA is $22.00, about 5.1% below its last closing price of $23.13

data.title: Uruguay Trade Deficit Widens in September
data.description:
Uruguay’s trade deficit widened to USD 16.94 million in September 2025 from USD 11.94 million a year earlier.

Imports rose 4.7% year-on-year to USD 1,184.1 million.

Purchases of consumer goods increased 4.3%, supported by a 1.4% rise in food and beverages and a 1.1% gain in vehicles.

Imports of capital goods grew 1.1%, with machinery and equipment up 1.4%, while purchases of intermediate goods declined 0.3% as oil and distillate imports fell 3.1%.

Exports rose 12.9% to USD 1,167.2 million, driven by primary products (+19.5%) and manufactured goods (+10.3%), while utilities exports fell 14.3%.

data.title: Twilio Is Maintained at Overweight by JP Morgan
California City of Manteca to Sell $48 Million of Wastewater Revenue Bonds
data.description:
By Chris Wack

The Manteca Financing Authority of California plans to issue $48 million of bonds to finance improvements in its wastewater system.

Proceeds from the Series 2025 Wastewater Revenue Bonds will also be used to refinance the Series 2009 sewer revenue bonds and City of Manteca Series 2012 sewer revenue bonds, according to a document posted Thursday on MuniOS.

The bonds will provide about $30 million for improvements to Manteca's wastewater system, including work on a dewatering unit, a sludge thickener unit, and the wastewater system's collection system.

Pricing is scheduled for Nov. 6 and closing is set for Nov. 25.

The bonds are special obligations of the authority and repayment is secured by a pledge of revenue from the wastewater system of the city.

Interest is payable starting on June 1 and again Dec. 1. The securities are subject to optional redemption starting on Dec. 1, 2035. The bonds reach final maturity in December 2055.

The Manteca Financing Authority was created in 1991 for the purpose of issuing bonds to finance the purchase, construction and improvement of certain capital improvements for the city. Located in San Joaquin County, Manteca is about 75 miles east of San Francisco.

S&P Global Ratings assigned the bonds a rating of AA.

Ramirez & Co. is lead underwriter.

Write to Chris.Wack@wsj.com

data.title: LKQ Corp reports results for the quarter ended September 30 - Earnings Summary
data.description:
• LKQ Corp reported quarterly adjusted earnings of 84 cents​​ per share for the quarter ended September 30, lower than the same quarter last year, when the company reported EPS of 88 cents. The mean expectation of seven analysts for the quarter was for earnings of 76 cents per share. Wall Street expected results to range from 63 cents to 83 cents per share.

  • Revenue fell 2.4% to $3.50 billion from a year ago; analysts expected $3.54 billion.

  • LKQ Corp's reported EPS for the quarter was 70 cents​.

  • The company reported quarterly net income of $180 million.

  • LKQ Corp shares had risen by 2.0% this quarter and lost 15.2% so far this year.

FORECAST CHANGES

  • The mean earnings estimate of analysts had fallen by about 6.6% in the last three months.​

  • In the last 30 days, there have been no negative revisions of earnings estimates

RECOMMENDATIONS

  • The current average analyst rating on the shares is "buy" and the breakdown of recommendations is 7 "strong buy" or "buy," 2 "hold" and no "sell" or "strong sell." The average consensus recommendation for the auto, truck & motorcycle parts peer group is also "buy"

  • Wall Street's median 12-month price target for LKQ Corp is $44.26, about 29.6% above its last closing price of $31.16

This summary was machine generated from LSEG data October 31 at 07:07 p.m. UTC. ​All figures in US dollars unless otherwise stated. Freedom Farms to Attend the 51st Annual New Orleans Investment Conference
data.description:
Jayuya, Puerto Rico--(Newsfile Corp. - October 31, 2025) - Freedom Farms announced today that it will be participating in the 51st Annual New Orleans Investment Conference at the Hilton New Orleans Riverside November 2 - 5, 2025. Mike Maloney, Founder, will be presenting and is looking forward to networking with investors during the Conference - see below for exact times. 

The New Orleans Investment Conference gathers some of the world’s brightest and most successful analysts, newsletter writers and investors. This year’s event will highlight all major asset classes, including Agriculture.

About Freedom Farms

Freedom Farms is a 900-acre organic, regenerative farm in Puerto Rico's mountains, focused on reversing environmental impact while producing premium food through permaculture practices. The operation combines atmospheric carbon sequestration with off-grid clean energy and market-leading agricultural production.

New Orleans Investment Conference Details: Mr. Maloney will be part of the Opening Event, Sunday November 2nd, from 4pm to 7:05pm in the Grand Ballroom, as well as two Main Stage presentations on Monday November 3rd, at 11:35am, and again at 7:25pm. And(!) There is also a yet-to-be-disclosed closing event where Mike is part of an all-star panel. Mike and the Freedom Farms team will be at BOOTH #327 and we look forward to speaking with you about this long-awaited visionary overhaul in agriculture.

About The New Orleans Investment Conference

The New Orleans Investment Conference is the one place where the world’s most sophisticated investors gather every year to discover new opportunities and strategies, exchange ideas, plan for the coming year and enjoy the camaraderie of like-minded individuals in America’s most fascinating and entertaining city.

Headliners at the New Orleans Conference over the last 50 years have included Lady Margaret Thatcher, former President Gerald Ford, novelist Ayn Rand, General H. Norman Schwarzkopf, Nobel Prize-winning economists Milton Friedman and F.A. Hayek, Dr. Henry Kissinger, Senator Barry Goldwater, Admiral Hyman Rickover, Louis Rukeyser, Sir John Templeton, Lord William Rees-Mogg, Charlton Heston, Jeane Kirkpatrick, Robert Bleiberg, Jack Kemp, William F. Buckley, General Colin Powell, Ron Paul and J. Peter Grace, among hundreds of other notables.

This year’s speakers line-up includes the likes of Matt Taibbi…Rick Rule...Mary Katharine Ham…Danielle DiMartino Booth…Brent Johnson…George Gammon…Peter St. Onge…Viva Frei…Robert Kiyosaki…Peter Boockvar…Jim Bianco…Jim Iuorio…Adam Taggart…Peter Schiff…Adrian Day…Mike Maloney…Alex Green…Dave Collum…Robert Prechter…Robert Helms…Russ Gray…

PLUS Mark Skousen...Lawrence Lepard…Jordan Roy-Byrne…Dan Oliver…Jeff Phillips…Lobo Tiggre…Tavi Costa…Nick Hodge…Chris Powell…Dana Samuelson…Jennifer Shaigec…Rich Checkan…Thom Calandra…Mary Anne & Pamela Aden…Omar Ayales…Bill Murphy…Gerardo Del Real…Steve Hochberg…Albert Lu…Lindsay Hall...Kerry Stevenson… and more, including Brien Lundin, host of this illustrious event.

Don’t miss out. Register for the 51st Annual New Orleans Investment Conference by clicking here.

For additional information, please contact:

Freedom Farms

Phil Sarsons

Senior Project Developer

2508259264

phil@freedomfarmspr.com 

https://www.ffpr.farm/

data.title: Trump says US, Canada will not restart trade talks
data.description:
U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday the United States and Canada will not restart trade talks but Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney apologized to him for an Ontario political ad using former President Ronald Reagan saying tariffs spell disaster.

"I like him a lot but what they did was wrong," he said. "He apologized for what they did with the commercial because it was a false commercial."

Carney did not immediately respond to requests for comment.

Trump last week called off negotiations over the advertisement aired by the Canadian province of Ontario, adding he was increasing tariffs on Canada by an additional 10%.

The ad by the Ontario government featured Republican icon Reagan saying that tariffs on foreign goods while lead to trade wars and job losses.

Reagan was known for his support of free markets and free trade.

data.title: Yen faces worst monthly drop since July as BOJ disappoints
data.description:
Key points:
  • BOJ holds rates, disappoints traders hoping for hawkish stance
  • Fed dampens expectations for December rate cut, dollar gains
  • Euro and sterling fall as ECB and BOE maintain rates

By Karen Brettell

The Japanese yen was heading for a monthly loss against the U.S. dollar on Friday after the Bank of Japan disappointed traders hoping for a more hawkish stance on future rate hikes, while the Federal Reserve dampened expectations for a December rate cut.

The yen clawed back some losses after Japanese Finance Minister Satsuki Katayama said the government has been monitoring foreign exchange movements with a high sense of urgency as the yen weakens.

Core inflation in Tokyo also accelerated in October and stayed above the central bank's 2% target, data showed on Friday.

But disappointment after BOJ Governor Kazuo Ueda adopted a less hawkish tone on future rate hikes than hoped held the yen in check. The Japanese central bank kept rates on hold at 0.5%.

Noel Dixon, global macro strategist at State Street Global Markets, said he remains constructive on the yen, adding that “the BOJ ultimately is still going to have to normalize policy at least to 1%.”

“From a multi-year perspective, wages are definitely higher than they've been … and the fiscal spending is only going to exacerbate that prospect,” Dixon said.

Japan’s newly elected leader, Sanae Takaichi, is expected to pursue more fiscally expansive policies to boost economic growth.

The yen was last flat on the day and heading for its worst month since July, with the dollar up 4.2% against the currency this month.

The dollar index rose 0.35% to 99.82 and is on track for a 2% monthly gain, its best since July.

DIVIDED FEDERAL RESERVE

The greenback has been boosted by optimism over the economic outlook even as the labor market weakens, while Fed policymakers remain concerned about inflation.

Fed Chair Jerome Powell said on Wednesday that a policy divide within the U.S. central bank and a lack of federal government data may put another interest rate cut out of reach this year.

“It sounded like he was just trying to give himself some optionality,” said Dixon.

The Fed cut rates on Wednesday, as expected, though two policymakers dissented. Governor Stephen Miran again called for a deeper reduction in borrowing costs, while Kansas City Fed President Jeffrey Schmid favored no cut.

Schmid said on Friday that he dissented out of concern that continued high inflation and signs of price pressures spreading in the economy could raise doubts about the central bank's commitment to its 2% inflation target.

Dallas Fed President Lorie Logan said on Friday that the Fed should not have cut interest rates this week and Cleveland Fed President Beth Hammack said she also opposed the rate cut.

Atlanta Fed President Raphael Bostic said on Friday a December rate cut is not locked in.

Fed funds futures traders are pricing in a 63% probability of a cut in December, down from 93% a week ago, according to the CME Group’s FedWatch Tool.

Dixon said he expects the dollar index to consolidate under technical resistance at around 102, before gaining next year when growth is likely to accelerate.

“From a positioning standpoint, it's clear that investors, at least from a real money perspective, are maxed out from a short perspective, so I think it's difficult to short it,” he added.

EURO, STERLING DROP

The euro dropped 0.37% to $1.1522 after the European Central Bank kept interest rates unchanged at 2% for the third meeting in a row on Thursday and repeated that policy was in a "good place" as economic risks recede. The single currency has fallen 1.8% this month, as the dollar gains broadly.

Sterling fell 0.14% to $1.3132, the lowest since April 14, as political pressures grew surrounding British Finance Minister Rachel Reeves. Against the euro, the pound reached its weakest since May 2023.

The pound is heading for a 2.3% drop this month, while gilt yields have dropped on concern over what Reeves' November budget might mean for businesses, households and overall economic activity.

Traders are also pricing in rising odds of a Bank of England interest rate cut, though the British central bank is viewed as most likely keeping rates on hold when it meets next week.

"While we think GBP sentiment has turned overly bearish, we have long argued against fading the move ahead of the Budget, not to mention the tail risk of the BoE cutting rates next week," Bank of America analysts said in a report.

In cryptocurrencies, bitcoin gained 1.34% to $108,972.
